page.title: 09Education in Mousehole
page.content: {Mousehole}has a Junior and Infants School with about eighty pupils altogether. There are three teachers, a headmaster and two class teachers. The first day school in Mousehole was provided by the{Methodists}during 1848 and was run by a board of Trustees with each pupil paying three pence a week. Today the state pays for the childrens education unless the parents choose to send them to a private school, the nearest one to {Mousehole}being at{Penzance.} When the children reach the age of eleven most will transfer from the village school to{Mount's Bay Comprehensive School} which is at Heamoor, Penzance. Further education after the age of sixteen is provided by the Penwith {Sixth Form College}at Penzance, or at the{Cornwall Technical College}which is at{Camborne.
